Sometimes a player might not be able to play to their strengths, such as an archer running out of arrows, or a swordsman fighting a flying enemy. Fortunately they can use a variety of magical potions to help even the odds, though it's probably best to try them before you need them, since the first time you try a potion of a given colour, you don't know what it will do.
206626.name: Daydream Dungeon

206627.name: Power Outage
206627.description:
User summary:

This intriguing game uses most familiar concepts and processes from standard tabletop gaming but uses several ingenious methods to reduce complex things to relatively simple visual representations. Characters are pre-generated and selected. Combat uses a type of action table, or "flowchart". Trackable values are relatively few in number and use generally small values.

This item contains the core rules, the setting of "parallel Earth", and a variety of adventure hooks or ideas.

206628.name: The Zombie Squad
206628.description:
A Tales from the Void Story

From the introduction:

Penal Prison 35xv6 Deimos.

The Alarm went off like it always did at 5.30am galactic time, but for Matt Hodges, once Corporal Matt Hodges of the HarpTec Marines, today was different. Today, in exactly three hours, he would be standing in the rec area facing the firing squad.

Publisher's blurb:

For crimes against the Corporations you have been sent to Military prison to await execution. As that fateful day arrives and you prepare to meet the firing squad a Colonel in the 2nd Penal Battalion offers you a choice, sign on the dotted line and join the worst bunch of criminals in the Universe, doing the jobs that are deemed either to dangerous, illegal or dirty for corporate troops or, get full of lead and buried in the latrines.

As you sign your own death certificate the Colonel grins, a grin that matches those of the Deaths Heads on his Lapels. "Welcome to The Zombie Squad."

206629.name: Spikeout: Battle Street
206629.description:
Spikeout: Battle Street is a beat 'em up video game for the Xbox home console. It was developed by Dimps and published by Sega, and is a successor to Sega's Spikeout series.
Source: Wikipedia, "https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spikeout:_Battle_Street," available under the CC-BY-SA License.

206631.name: The Long Journey Home
206631.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – UNAVAILABLE




This game has officially been announced by the publisher or developer, but has not yet been released and made available for purchase. Therefore some of the information above may change in the future. Until this game is released, please do not submit images for it, nor add new releases. Press Kits are an exception and a maximum of six can be added.




FROM THE BRIDGE OF YOUR SHIP, YOU SEE A MILLION POINTS OF LIGHT.

ONLY ONE OF THEM MATTERS. HOME.

It was only supposed to be a short trip. But when your jump drive malfunctions, you and a mismatched crew of specialists along for the ride find yourselves trapped and alone on the wrong side of the galaxy.

The only way back is through.

Forge alliances with strange alien races. Explore distant worlds for the secrets and technologies they hide. Harness your crew’s skills, from archeology to diplomacy. Make deals and moral decisions that change the universe. Do whatever it takes to survive.

And every game, enter a new galaxy. Will you find yourself welcomed by traders and noble warrior knights... or surrounded by pirates, psychopaths, and an unspeakable cosmic horror that threatens to snuff out the stars themselves.

One destination. Endless adventures.

Where will your Journey take you?

Source: The Game Website.

206632.name: L'Appel de Cthulhu 7e edition: Prestige
rpgissuearticle: Retour historique sur l'Appel de Cthulhu
206632.description:
This is the French version of the 7th edition, in a deluxe box set that was funded on the Ulule crowdfunding website.

Description from the publisher website in French:

Le jeu de rôle d’épouvante et d’aventures dans les univers d’Howard Phillips Lovecraft.

Avec L’Appel de Cthulhu, prenez la place d’audacieux investigateurs des années 1920 ou de toutes autres époques. Percez les secrets multimillénaires de divinités inconnues ou partez à la recherche de lieux ignorés des hommes. Défiez des créatures innommables repliées dans l’ombre qui, depuis l’aube des temps, préparent leur retour sur Terre. Déjouez leurs plans et survivez à l’affrontement sans sombrer dans la folie !

Cette Édition Prestige abrite la septième édition du plus grand jeu de rôle de tous les temps. Elle s’appuie sur une révision du fameux Basic System : les règles pratiquées depuis la première édition par tous les joueurs de L’Appel de Cthulhu. Elle reste donc entièrement compatible avec tous les suppléments parus et à paraître, pour des milliers d’heures d’aventures.

Mais surtout, elle propose un contenu entièrement nouveau, qui doit son existence aux 3 500 contributeurs dont les noms ont été gravés à jamais dans ses pages. Grâce à eux, ce coffret regroupe des ouvrages et des accessoires dont une grande partie n’est pas disponible ailleurs dans le commerce (notés *).
• Le Manuel du Gardien (deux scénarios inclus)
• Le Manuel de l’Investigateur
• Les Aventures Effroyables (huit scénarios et deux aides de jeu)
• Les aides de jeu d’Aventures Effroyables*
• L’Écran de jeu 3 volets et son livret
• 84 fiches pratiques de créatures*
• 46 fiches pratiques de Personnages Non Joueurs type personnalisées (dont celle d’H.P. Lovecraft)*
• Six marque-pages résumé des règles*
• Une clef USB avec les versions PDF des ouvrages, les fiches de personnages, les cartes, deux campagnes adaptées en V7 et l’écran de l’année 2008.*
• Une lithographie de Loïc Muzy*
• Un porte-mine teinte aluminium*
• Un set de neuf dés Cthulhu et leur bourse en suédine
• Le planisphère du Mythe*
• L’Euclidosphère du Mythe*
• L’Étude des Morphologies du Mythe*
• L’Atlas de l’Abominable (en 7 cartes)*
• Les cartes des Terres de Lovecraft (Arkham, Dunwich, Innsmouth et Kingsport)*
• Les deux mappemondes des années 20*
• Un bloc de 50 fiches de personnage vierges*

La version réservée aux souscripteurs du financement participatif contient également le Malleus Monstrum et un artbook.

206634.name: Magic Flute
206634.description:
‘Magic Flute by Mozart’ is a game not only for opera lovers, but for all those who enjoy fun, smart and beautifully crafted puzzle games. Featuring Mozart’s music and the story of ‘The Magic Flute’ opera.

Slide tiles to build a path and help Tamino exit the stage. Choose your steps wisely, build your path avoiding traps, deadly serpents or guards who want to catch you. But know no fear, lose no hope and remember that you are the master of your own path. Mind that each level can be finished in multiple ways.

Source: The Developer Website.

206635.name: Untamed: Life Of A Cougar
206635.description:
Untamed: Life of a Cougar allows you to experience the life of a Mountain Lion (Puma, Cougar). You will fight other mountain lions for territory, find a mate and raise cubs of your own which will grow into adults as your parenting skills are put to the test. Hunt prey both big and small as you level up to become a more effective and lethal hunter, and fight off predators which pose an ever present danger to you and your cubs and ultimately come face to face with Man in the form of hunters who will waste no time to put you at the center of an active hunt.

Source: The Developer Website.

206636.name: Das Erbe der Löwensöhne
rpgpublisher: Verlag für Fantasy- und Science Fiction-Spiele
206636.description:
user translation from back of the book

Fabulous wealth and strange customs, spices and jewels in abundance. Proud aristocrats indulge in luxury and let themself be spoiled by velvet eyed beauties. Scruffy ascetics enjoy great reputation like erudite priests, and both look snooty down on the common people. But Rawindra is also a land of merciless struggles between humans and scaly monsters, fought with powerful magic and ancient sorcery. Since generations the Rawindi stand against the lizardfolk of the Sritras with its strange magic and habits, which worships dark gods in the depths of the jungle.

The rawindian culture is the legacy of the Lions sons, horsemen who also founded the trading city of Ulwar on the way the beads. Without the shackles of the caste system and laws that allow anything that doesn't disturb the circles of the rich and powerful, most Rawindi consider the city as a haven of immorality and chaos. That Ulwar with its wealth, its sword slaves and its fleet of corsairs is a serious threat to rawindian princes, also contributes to this disgust.

This Sourcebook describes the south western part of Sirao from the Island of Serendib to the Kirita Mountains. Besides the presentation the people and their culture, the book contains local weapons, skills and spells, important personalities and typical adventurers, a detailed bestiary and a coloured map.

206637.name: Kalidonas Herbarium
rpgpublisher: Verlag für Fantasy- und Science Fiction-Spiele
206637.description:
user translation of publisher blurb
The Herbarium is an alphabetical collection of various herbs. Kalidona vom Tränensteingraben gathered her knowledge, that she acquired in Vesternesse and Northern Sirao, and even added pictures of the plants for better identification. In total there are 85 herbs and their effects on body and senses.

206638.name: Kuldkarikas
206638.description:
Biathlon-themed board game.

Goal of the game: To fi nish the race first.
Players roll die and move on the path, with some special spaces.
In shooting range player rolls the special die (with black-white dots) 5 or more times and if missed must make penalty round.

Player who finishes first is the winner.

206639.description:
This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop.

There is an extra set of Tourist cards, each with a value to be earned by visiting that city. These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules.There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks - but there are Chance cards to pick up on several routes which offer advantages and disadvantages.

There are many new options in the rules: exchange all your cards at the start but keep all the new ones: discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn: earn extra points: and many more. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
206639.name: Serbia (fan expansion of Ticket to Ride)

206640.name: Thalassa und der Bettlerkönig (Midgard 5th Edition)
rpgpublisher: Verlag für Fantasy- und Science Fiction-Spiele
206640.description:
user summary
This is an updated version of the sourcebook Thalassa und der Bettlerkönig. It has a slightly bigger rules section (about 8 pages), which includes the description of the Order of the Death Weavers (Orden der Todeswirker) and rules for the Death Weaver class originally published in Das Kompendium.

206641.name: Gildenbrief (Issue 63 - Jul 2015)
rpgpublisher: Verlag für Fantasy- und Science Fiction-Spiele
206641.description:
user summary

The first issue for the 5th Edition of Midgard and also the final issue of the Gildenbrief at all, as chief editor Thomas Losleben wrote in his editorial.

Articles of this issue that are considered official:


Rang & Namen - (page 36 & 57)

206642.name: Gildenbrief 22-27
rpgpublisher: Verlag für Fantasy- und Science Fiction-Spiele
206642.description:
user summary

A collection of issues 22 to 27 of Gildenbrief magazine.

206643.name: Die Insel des Widdergottes
rpgpublisher: Verlag für Fantasy- und Science Fiction-Spiele
206643.description:
User Summary:

A PDF Version of two old adventures which have been upated to the 5th Edition of Midgard.


Über den Perellion-Pass (Over the Perellion Pass) by Jürgen E. Franke
Die Insel des Widdergottes (The Island of the God Ram) by Bernd Lindenberger

206644.name: Ein Geist in Nöten (Midgard 5th Edition)
rpgpublisher: Verlag für Fantasy- und Science Fiction-Spiele
206644.description:
User Summary

Queen Radamalona of the Akimba of Serendib sends the character to the lands of Rawindra to recover the bones of one of her ancestors and save its spirit from destruction. The journey proves to be more dangerous than thought at first.

Unlike the original release for the 3rd Edition of Midgard this release doesn't contain the adventure Der verschwundene Saddhu (The disappeared Saddhu).

206645.name: Remnants Of Isolation
206645.description:
User Summary

Remnants of Isolation is a fantastic roleplaying game made with RPGMaker by Team Isolation.

206646.name: Die Krone der Drachen (Midgard 5th Edition)
rpgpublisher: Verlag für Fantasy- und Science Fiction-Spiele
206646.description:
User Summary

The Crown of Dragons, an important artifact was stolen during a caravan raid. The characters have to enter the jungles of Rawindra to retrieve it.

This version has been updated to the 5th Edition of Midgard. Unlike the 3rd Edition issue of this adventure it doesn't contain the adventure Huracans Heimkehr (Huracan's Homecoming).

206647.name: Guardians of Victoria
206647.description:
Guardians of Victoria is a Steampunk platformer that gives players the control over three unique characters- Brella, Cutlass and Firearm, named for their weapons of choice. Each character has their own level to play in the Victorian sky city of Victoria. Run, jump, glide, and shoot your way across 12 long and challenging levels before finishing in a daring shoot-out where you take control of the Guardian's flying pirate ship. If you love artsy platformers with a challenge then this is the game for you!

Rise up as a fellow guardian, unlock the comic book story of Ripper and Zeal, upgrade your characters stats, try out your combat skills in the training arena, and take back the city

Source: The Developer Website.

206648.name: Das Lied der Nagafrau (Midgard 5th Edition)
rpgpublisher: Verlag für Fantasy- und Science Fiction-Spiele
206648.description:
Publisher Blurb (User Translation):

Scandal in the temple of Hanumat! During the annual elephant festival the priests could not perform the spiritual union with the deity: the Surma, the divine drug, proved to be unclean. A scapegoat is found quickly: an unfortunate alchemist, whose only hope now are the adventurers! They need to visit an old shaman who lives at the foot of Meru Mountains in a ruined city, and ask his advice, for he has knowledge about ivory, the main ingredient of the Surma.

User Summary

This version has been updated to the 5th Edition of Midgard. Unlike the 3rd Edition issue of this adventure it doesn't contain the adventure Der Raub der Blume.

206649.name: Dead6hot
206649.description:
User Summary

Dead6hot is a fast paced platform shooting game developed by Chuck Productions.

206650.name: Der verschwundene Saddhu
rpgpublisher: Verlag für Fantasy- und Science Fiction-Spiele
206650.description:
Publisher Blurb (User Translation):

In addition to the dangers of the jungle of Rawindra one can get to know the special charm of a sophisticated religion. In the Ashram of a traditional sect the adventurers learn about the wisdom of the local Gurus firsthand, and while they are there they have the opportunity to solve the mystery of the missing Saddhu - assuming their spirit is strong enough to withstand the messengers of the goddess Kalaratri.

206651.name: Schatten in der Nacht
rpgpublisher: Verlag für Fantasy- und Science Fiction-Spiele
206651.description:
Publisher Blurb (User Translation):
The animal dealer Haranbal Senuthus returns to Ceregion from the deep jungles of the Ikenga basin, where he managed to capture a rare giant sloth, a Ribanga. With the other captive animals it is now to be taken to Varuna, to show it to the nobles. Then unfortunately the axis of the wagon breaks, and the Ribanga escapes into the night. Good that the adventurers are at hand which can be entrusted with the capture of the animal.

On the same day the coach of the young nobleman Donja Concetta Chiagarna di Prageno e Hortejo is robbed. Another strike of the notorious bandit chief Salamar and his followers?

206652.name: Fractured Space
videogamehonor: 2016 PAX Curse Award Best MOBA of the Year Winner
206652.description:
Fractured Space is a competitive 5-v-5 tactical space battle game fought over five sectors. Brought to life in the stunning Unreal Engine 4, giants of interstellar conflict fight in spectacular close quarter battles for dominance.

Source: The Game Website.

206653.name: Chicken Domino
206653.description:
A dominoes game played with a set of double-nine dominoes with a starting center piece. The objective of the game is to play all of the tiles in your hand and have the highest score at the end of the game.

This game is derived from the game of "Cyrus" with added features to make it more challenging.

206654.name: That Level Again
206654.description:
User summary

That Level Again is an "experimental puzzle" 2D platform game. The player controls a small character who must exit the stage, usually by the door on the right of the screen. However, how this door is opened or reached varies with each level, and the only hint the player gets is a small level description. The solutions include a lot of thinking outside the box.

206655.name: That Level Again 2
206655.description:
User summary

That Level Again 2 is a follow-up of the original game. This time, the character wants to get out of a house, and each screen has just a simple hint on how to get out. A lot of thinking outside of the box.

206656.name: That Level Again 3
206656.description:
User summary

In That Level Again 3, the game isn't simply the same screen over and over again. Instead, the character is walking through several screens, each of them requiring some special trick in order to leave.

The also runs in circles, having the player coming back to the start. In order to reach the real ending, the player needs to find where to get out of the loop.

206657.name: Supraball
206657.description:
Supraball is a multiplayer game developed by SupraGames and first released in 2014. It is the successor to Deathball, a 2003 modification for Unreal Tournament 2003 and Unreal Tournament 2004.

Supraball's gameplay mostly resembles sports like football, handball, basketball and rugby. It is being played in first person view. The teams in Supraball consist of 3 or 5 players.

Supraball was first released in May 2014 in an alpha version and remains in development.

Source: Wikipedia, "[en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Supraball Supraball]", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

206658.name: Thrice Nice Mice
206658.description: Thrice Nice Mice is a ten-card microgame in which players try to find a row of Three hidden mice in order to score points.

206659.name: Epyllion Dragon Deck
206659.description:
From the Publisher:

The Epyllion Dragon Deck is full of 28 interesting pre-made dragon characters for your next game of Epyllion and beyond. The cards include the dragon's names, ages, occupations, demeanors, desires, Houses, moons—everything you need to bring them into a game of Epyllion, or anywhere else!

206660.name: Overture of Kings
206660.description:
Description from the publisher:

Overture of Kings is a fantasy based card game for 2-6 players. It is set in a fictional world, but it uses many familiar medieval tones. The players assume the roles of the kings, and must build their armies while at the same time preventing the other kings from building theirs.
The game consists of two decks of cards; one primarily used to build your army and the other used for attacks and other actions. Overture of Kings requires strategy and planning, but there are elements that involve the luck of the draw and die rolls.
There are two player decks designed around the same rules and full games which are more complex and take longer to play. Also, there are Alliance game rules around which tournament play has evolved Included in the game are two types of optional cards that will either make the game easier for new players, extend the length of the round or both. It takes between 30 minutes to 2 hours to play a round depending on the optional cards used and the experience levels of the players.
Overture of Kings is easy to learn, family friendly and fun. There is a quick start guide to help new players understand the basics quickly as well as a full rule book for more detailed explanations of the game.

206661.name: Quick Fixture
206661.description:
Description from the publisher:

A free, downloadable PDF, fast-play, solitaire soccer simulation for generating league tables (standings) and basic statistics. Quick Fixture was intended to be a companion to other more detailed, longer playing games, but many gamers enjoy just replaying a season using this game alone.

Key statistics such as winning percentage, goals scored, and goals allowed are translated to team ratings for both home and away performance. In other words, each team is rated twice for a "basic" season. The team ratings make it easy to adjust for certain in-game events, such as injuries or playing short-handed.

Select leagues and seasons are rated as "complete" seasons, adding a bit more detail. A complete season includes players rated in distribution ranges for goal scoring and for discipline (yellow/red cards) which adds a lot to the story of a match.

This game is for the solitaire gamer who wants to quickly generate realistic results and enjoy a league or tournament from a high-level, observer point of view. See the website below for more details.

206662.description:
Sent to backers of the 2016 Kickstarter campaign for Alternate Histories, A Quartermaster General Expansion .

Details on this card:

Used by each player, before shuffling their decks at the beginning of the game, Take one Status or Response card from your deck and place it face-down on the table. Players who chose Status cards reveal them simultaneously; these cards begin the game in play. Then players shuffle and proceed as usual.
206662.name: Quartermaster General: Alternate Histories – Preparing for War! Promo Tile

206663.description:
Sent to backers of the 2016 Kickstarter campaign for Alternate Histories, A Quartermaster General Expansion .

Details on this card:

May be used by each player at their own option, after creating their opening hands of cards. Discard one additional card. Then examine the top 10 cards of your draw deck and take 1 of the cards into hand. Then shuffle the other 9 back into your Draw Deck.
206663.name: Quartermaster General: Alternate Histories – Research Promo Tile

206664.name: Megacorp Trading Card Game
206664.description:
Description from the publisher:

An epic cyberpunk card game, designed for 1v1 or up to 9 players.

Megacorp is a card game that thrills cyberpunk genre fans with an ingame universe consisting of genetic modified transhumanists, psychic prophets that can move mountains at will and incorporated citizens who buy and sell their very selves on the stock market; a dark realist theme (with mature overtones like political intrigue, covert ops, genocide, euthanisia and more) which celebrates the triumph of capitalism taken to the extreme. Governments no longer exist and corporations are the primary actors of human destiny.

Players take the role of business founders in year 10,000 AD with the objective of eliminating their commercial adversaries via bankruptcy, buying out their businesses or isolating their rival business through destroying all assets connected to them.

The game is designed for competitive play, with sanctioned tournaments due to be launched following pre-release (kickstarter campaign) completion.

The current version consists of 4 pre-built card decks (62 cards each) complete with a unique founder from one of the 3 factions of humanity: Corp, Incarnate, Gnost. Dimesions and weight listed are reflective of ONE deck.

206665.name: Ground Breakers
206665.description:
Ground Breakers is a Turn based tactic game that breaks traditional class system. Each unit is unique with endless ways of customization.The process of acquiring new units is also fun in itself, you must find each part of a robot and integrate them to get it without knowing the recipes.

A few centuries after the apocalypse, ice in the two poles have melted and the earth has no land left. Disorder and riot occurs everywhere. Governments were destroyed. People built giant cubes and linked them together to have a place to live on. Minerals became rare and hold much value. All the big corporates and organizations rise to powers and start to trade, research robot run by water to dominate mineral rich areas.

Source: The Game Website.

206666.name: Beneath Nexus
206666.description:
Description from the publisher:

Centuries ago, the city of Nexus was built around a well of magical power hidden deep below the earth. Over the ages, Nexus soared to incredible wealth and power. Wandering tribes flocked to the city to worship and learn from the mysterious magicks beneath it.
As Nexus grew, more and more power was drawn from the well. And as more power was drawn, the more unstable the energies of the well became. After millennia of providing Nexus with knowledge and might, the well gave the city something new. Blight.

Beneath Nexus is an asymmetrical dungeon crawling card game for 3 to 6 players. One player acts as the Blight Lord, an evil overlord who corrupted the great city of Nexus centuries ago. All other players play the heroes who have come to Nexus to reclaim it from the powerful Blight Lord.

Beneath Nexus's fantasy theme was inspired by the big tabletop rpgs like D&D, Pathfinder, and Dungeonworld. Players of Magic: the Gathering, Sentinels of the Multiverse, and Lunch Money will recognize the card-based mechanics and gameplay.

We at Silverclutch Games created Beneath Nexus for hobbyist gamers to introduce casual gamers and new players to fantasy adventure. Beneath Nexus can be learned within 10 minutes and is both competitive and cooperative with its one vs many format. Hobbyist gamers will find the unique heroes and Blight Lords engaging and challenging to master due to variable player powers, difficult dungeon cards, and the vast array of monsters to combat with their own unique abilities.

206668.name: Beszamel
206668.description:
From publisher blurb:

Beszamel to gra o wspolnym tworzeniu opowiesci. Siadacie do niej we dwie lub wiecej osob. Jeden gracz bdzie Bajarzem, a pozostale beda odgrywac Bohaterow. Opowiadacie legende o swoich postaciach, o tym, co im sie przytrafilo i czego dokonali.

Beszamel to baniowa kraina pena zamkow, skarbow, smokow i przygod. Jest jedna rzecz, ktora rozni Beszamel od wszystkich innych wiatow. W Beszamelu wszystko kreci si wokol jedzenia. Najwazniejszymi miejscami sa karczmy na rozstajach drog, wojownicy wladaj w walce zaostrzonymi widelcami, czarodzieje ziona pomienna czkawka, a straszliwi orkowie kradn ser.

Ruszamy!


Translation courtesy of Google:

Béchamel Sauce is a game about creating a common story. You sit down to it in two or more people. One player will be a storyteller, and the remaining will play a Heroes. Tells the legend of its forms, about what happened to them and what they did.

Béchamel Sauce is baniowa land pena castles, treasure, dragons and adventure. There is one thing that Béchamel Sauce is different from all other worlds. In a béchamel everything revolves around food. The most important places are the inn at the crossroads road warriors to fight Wlad pointed forks, wizards ziona pomienna hiccups, Orcs and the dreaded stealing cheese.

Let's move!

206669.name: Mutant Legion
206669.description:
From publisher blurb:

S.I.D.s is short for Super-powered Individual Database. This is a database that various government agencies are starting to use to keep track of all the various villains and heroes. Over the last few years the number of super-powered individuals has skyrocketed.

It has become a full time job to try and keep track of them as well as update information about the, that is the purpose of this database. The database is designed to give law enforcement as much information as possible on supervillains or superheroes they may need to call for help.

This installment will introduce a new organization The Mutant Legion, originally presented in Villainy Codex I. This organization is the logical creation of the anti-mutant hysteria. Mutants banded together to protect each other, not heroes or villains simply mutants! Listed is a group of 9 mutants and growing every day.

206670.name: Wondrous Treasures: Armor
206670.description:
From publisher blurb:

Every fantasy hero campaign needs magical treasures for the adventures to find.

This series houses information on varies information on just such treasures.

Armor - There are legends that tell of heroes with varies kinds of armor. From leather to plate, armor that can let the wearer fly to armor that can let the wearer disappear. There is armor for every situation and here you will find 34 sets of armor that can do almost anything.

206671.name: Avalon Spell Book 8
206671.description:
From publisher blurb:

Avalon takes a common spell and provides you with a number of alterations and additions to add excitement and useful options for your next adventure. Each issue of Avalon Spell Books will focus on a new spell, discussing different versions of the spell, providing different components that can be used to alter the way the spell works, and even adding feats and new magical items linked to the spell in question.

Death Delayed

While many spellcasters do know the o-level spell of stabilize, few of them use it often. The reason is that pretty much any healing magic can do the same stabilization trick, only better. Yet easy availability of this orison and its close range - when compared to touch-delivered cure wounds spells - grants it enough usefulness to survive in the spell lists.

A spell that taps body resources to fight off death still has some potential, and new uses for it are possible. The simplest of them require trained use of Heal skill, while more complicated ones bring development of new spells and magical items into existence, all of them increasing chances of survival for those who got unlucky enough and dropped to negative hit points.

206672.name: Eadnod Rockbeard
206672.description:
From publisher blurb:

Cohorts & Companions – Eadnod Rockbeard provides twenty stat blocks (CR 1/2 thru 19) for a lawful neutral male dwarf with cavalier levels utilizing both the beast rider and gendarme archetypes. He utilizes the lance and battle axe from astride his mount. Eadnod puts a priority on defense and critical hit feats to increase his durability in combat and damage potential.

At 7th level, this character gains a large boar mount which takes a bit of liberty on the beast rider archetype rules. A boar is not naturally Large size, but the image of a dwarven boar rider has become a staple of fantasy, and dire boars are large. The regular 4th level boar stats were augmented for Large size as described in the beast rider archetype at level 7 to make this mount.

This product is Pathfinder® Roleplaying Game compatible and gives you twenty ready-to-play stat blocks for a stalwart companion at all levels, 1 thru 20! Use these stat blocks to add companions or assistants to the party when players are absent, extra muscle is needed, or mercenaries are hired. This also gives the GM the ability to have potential cohorts on hand built at any level needed.

If you find the character’s history and other story elements not to your liking, you still have twenty NPC stat blocks you can use as standalone characters of your own naming and developing or as minions and other rabble. Increase your available NPC stat blocks at every character level (Challenge Rating 1/2 thru 19).

The Cohorts & Companions series is designed to make the GM’s life easier. Each release provides numerous stat blocks that can be used immediately along a specific theme. Locate a specific kind of foe to introduce into your campaign or collect them all to build a toolbox of NPCs to unleash at any time. Give your players a new ally today!

206673.name: Weird S*** Generator (Fantasy)
206673.description:
From publisher blurb:

Use these series of tables to create very strange objects, creatures and places. It's quick and easy to create some really messed up shit to confuse, intrigue, and even terrify your players.

206674.name: Encounter Generator: Wilderness (Fantasy)
206674.description:
From publisher blurb:

When wandering in the wilderness anything could happen! Start out by deciding on an appropriate level of danger (1,2 or 3), then roll a d100 on the appropriate table. The result will direct you to roll on another table or tables to finalize the encounter.

206675.name: Mundane Loot Tables By Wealth Level (Fantasy)
206675.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sometimes the PCs loot a house or check the pockets or bag of some random NPC. Don’t just give them a few coins, make it interesting and give them some some basic, mundane items using these tables! They are broken up into wealth categories, from Destitute all the way up to Filthy Rich. Choose how rich/fancy the targeted NPC or NPC’s house is, and roll a d100 or two on the appropriate table.

206676.name: Setting Fodder: Mudstead City Map and NPCs
206676.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the city of Mudstead. Includes a vector map of the city as well as eight fleshed-out NPCs who are important to the city.

206677.name: Seized Fire for the Ceasefire
206677.description:
From the introduction:

Fleur Sleetshaper was a rare gem of a dwarf: born from a northern clan, she dedicated her life to the study of fire and ice magic. After building an icy tower on a glacier, she helped found the crabbing village of Firnboro, but in the last thirty years, she and the people of Firnboro have disappeared. Did Fleur’s arcane studies have a hand in Firnboro’s disappearance?

User summary:

For 10th level characters.

206681.name: Space Base Mutiny
206681.description:
Description from the publisher:

Command units with unique race powers to take over systems in the base. Then turn those systems against your opponent!

Space Base Mutiny is a fast-paced game with a sci-fi theme. The goal is simple; a player wins when he or she has used up all of her tokens. On your turn, you can use a unit to invade an enemy space OR remove a unit from a system you control to use that system's power. You then check to see which systems (if any) you gained control of.

The game features Area Collection Powers. When you occupy 3 spaces of the same color, you gain control of that color system. Each system gives you a special power that you can use on future turns. You can use the Weapons System to attack 2 adjacent units, the Air Lock System to jettison 2 enemy units into the vacum of space, the Gravity System to tumble units around the base, and the Command System to negotiate disarmament.

In addition to these system powers, each token has one of 6 unique race powers. Each time you place a token to invade a space, you trigger that tokens's race power. Cyborgs hack into the systems, Parasites infect enemy tokens, Telepaths use mind control to attack adjacent tokens, Space Worms breach the hull to attack outer tokens, Humans negotiate disarmament, and Blobs copy the race powers of the tokens they attack.

206682.name: Encounter Generator: Civilized Countryside (Fantasy)
206682.description:
From publisher blurb:

Even wandering in the seemingly boring civilized countryside can turn up some interesting encounters.Start out by deciding on an appropriate level of danger (1,2 or 3), then roll a d100 on the appropriate table. The result will direct you to roll on another table or tables to finalize the encounter.

rpg: "Ma, Can I Help You with That?"
So Mom I Made This Sex Tape
You've Come a Long Way, Baby
206683.name: #Feminism: A Nano-Game Anthology
206683.description:
From the introduction:

We are feminists by necessity. Despite our talents and skills, our culture tells us—over and over again—to make ourselves small physically, emotionally, and intellectually, to do extra work without complaint, to let others take the credit. We are feminists because we do not accept that the price of occupying a space marked "woman" is self-effacement.

We are feminists because we believe that every human should have the opportunity to live up to their fullest potential. In today’s world, that is simply not possible. Sexism oppresses everyone, whether it’s the woman who does a second shift of housework at the end of her paying job, the man whose parental love for a child is deemed suspect, or the trans and gender-queer people whose identities are erased on census form.

We are feminists who believe that the culture we consume can help us begin to undo the harms of sexism. And yet, that is difficult when our culture and its consumption is steeped in it. In the literary world, there is an old adage that books about men speak to "humanity" while books about women are "for women."

It’s true in the world of roleplaying games too. Scenarios about five men doing, well, nearly anything, get labeled as "great games," while scenarios that focus on women's experiences are "for women." We want to expand the designation of "great games" to include works that speak to our own lived experience. Feminism belongs in analog game design because women are human too. We produced this collection to highlight feminist voices and to create space for explicitly feminist design.

Our designers had juicy ground to draw from. Game-wise, what could be better source material than a world that pushes people into unequal power relationships, regardless of their skills and interests? This collection highlights different aspects of that power dynamic, from situational comedy to high tragedy.

Our feminism is an inclusive and plural feminism. We welcomed participants of all genders and game design experience, and accepted all the games they produced. We asked each designer to write a game about an aspect of feminism that is important to them right now. Rather than culling the collection to fit our own ideology, we tried to help each author realize their own vision. With nearly three dozen designers, these games represent many different feminisms, reflective of their individual authors.

As legendary feminist bell hooks once wrote, "Feminism is for everybody." We wanted to make these games accessible to players of all genders and ideologies. The barrier to entry is low. Our games require few participants, little in the way of prep or props, and last an hour or less. They cover a wide range of topics and moods, so you’ll find funnier scenarios about the word "vulvas," dramas about women in the workplace, and heavier scenarios about rape and domestic violence.

We hope these games will help generate discussion in your community and inspire you to make your own feminist works.

206684.name: Romance of the Perilous Land
206684.description:
(publisher blurb)

ROMANCE OF THE PERILOUS LAND is a game very much inspired by the oldest fantasy roleplaying game created in the 1970s, but it is also its own creation. Rather than mixing lots of fantasy tropes and world folklore like the original game, Romance of the Perilous Land is firmly set it the world of British folklore, from the stories of King Arthur to the wonderful regional tales found throughout this green and pleasant land. As the name suggests, this is a world of romantic chivalry, but also of great danger posed by thieving brigands, evil knights and greedy giants. Creatures are quite rare and often hidden until they are angered by the machinations of humanity. In the Perilous Land you won’t find hundreds of dragons flocking the sky, but legends of a single Long Worm who has existed since time immemorial. Monsters are beings of wonder and terror, where just a group of mischievous boggarts can be the reason for an entire quest.

rpgseries: The Shackled City Adventure Path Conversion
206685.name: Flood Season
206685.description:
Publisher's blurb:

This is a conversion guide to [5th Edition for] the second chapter of The Shackled City Adventure Path.

User summary:

This product is an item-by-item conversion guide for The Shackled City Adventure Path as originally published in Dungeon. This conversion guide covers only the portion of the adventure path contained in Flood Season published in Dungeon (Issue 98 - May 2003) / Polyhedron (Issue 157). The original material is required to use this product.

206686.name: Fanhunter: Urban Warfare
206686.description:
Description from the publisher:

Welcome to Barnacity! Consider yourself under arrest.

Fanhunter is a crazy and violent universe set in the near future, in which all forms of geek culture and entertainment have been banned. But the brave members of the Resistance are determined to fight. For their right. To party!

Fanhunter: Urban Warfare is a a board game with miniatures for two or more players. Players alternate turns in which they move their miniatures on the diferent boards in order to complete any of the pre-designed missions. Each of the players will draw an activation counter from a bag in order to know which side’s turn it is. Then they will be able to activate any of their units or characters. Characters can perform actions, using D6’s in order to determine succes. Players will roll against a threshold number, and each result equal or higher than said threshold will result in a success.

The game includes a complete campaign with eight missions, which offer a narrative experience if played in order. The game also includes rules to design your own adventures, which expands the gaming lifespan of this game.

206687.name: The Idealist
206687.description:
In The Idealist, players explore characters who follow this arc: abandoning their strongest values and embracing corruption in the pursuit of power.

This is a story game for 2-5 players and will take 1-2 hours. The players will jointly create a setting and then individually create characters. Over the course of the game, players will describe scenes in which their characters betray their values in exchange for increasing power and influence.

206688.name: Tribes of Prax
206688.description:
Players take on the role of a tribal khan from one of the five Great tribes of Prax: Sable, Impala, High Llama, Bison and Morocanth. The aim of the game is to accumulate status for your tribe. The tribe with the highest status at the end of the game is the winner. Players need to shepherd all their precious resources carefully in order to guide their tribe to victory.

Tribes of Prax is played in turns each representing a Gloranthan year. A game will consist of between 8 and 12 turns. Each year is divided into several seasons and phases.

Tribes of Prax consists of a game board depicting the are of Prax, Glorantha, Spirit Plane board, tokens for each player and couple of decks for allied spirits and random events. The game board is divided into irregular areas. A type of terrain or unique location defines each area. Players' tokens are their herds, clans, khan, heroes, warriors and shaman.

Players also have power that acts as a currency in the game. New power for each round is gained from various positions. During the game players move their tokens to different areas in the map and do various acts using power. At the same time players try to balance with invading Lunar forces (not a player role). Their acts and herd size will determine how much status they gain among the other tribes. The player with most status after predefined amount of rounds is the winner.

206689.description:
Description from the publisher:

The route to the wintering grounds has been planned. As the adult narwhal(s), lure and shepherd the curious young narwhals along the way in time to get the tastiest fish. These are separate solitaire/co-op rules made to use the same components as Arctic Dash: A Narwhal Race.

You (and an optional second player) are trying to get 2 young narwhals from the start tile, across a short two tiles, to the end tile on the other side. Though not far, the child narwhals movement is dice driven, and they will frequently wander towards seaweed and interesting fish along the path, instead of where you may wish. The board grows organically to provide more distractions as the child narwhals roam.

With a roll of your own movement dice, you (and your optional second player) can pick up fish to lure the children, clear seaweed to remove distractions, and nudge the children along the path.

With luck, and no small amount of planning, you and the young narwhals will have plenty of tasty fish for the season!
206689.name: Arctic Dash: Curious Kids

206690.name: Scythe: Action Tokens
206690.description:
Upgrade from plain wooden pawns to these 3D printed Action Tokens designed to resemble wax seal stamps, complete with the faction logos on top.

Highlights adds color to the token tops to more closely resemble the logos.

PLEASE NOTE: This is not an official Stonemaier Games product. This is a 3D printed fan creation.

206691.description:
During the Kickstarter campaign Ninja Star offered this set of 8 character standees as an add-on. They would replace some of the cards used during the game.

There were only 100 sets made and they were sold on a 'first come, first served' basis.
206691.name: Wolf & Hound: Character Standees

206692.name: Escape from Groncho's Lair
206692.description:
From the publishers blurb:

Most adventures involve getting to the absolute bottom of a dungeon, blithely swinging hammers andswords through warriors and civilians, pillaging and looting along the way.

This adventure inverts the traditional model: The adventurers easily run through a surprisingly unpopulated goblin warren and then get struck with amnesia at the very bottom. They know their identities, skills and class abilities but have no idea what’s happened over the past several days. Players must fight their way out of the dungeon through increasingly threatening encounters, culminating in a “boss” battle as they hit the surface.

This adventure is designed to be system agnostic, but would be ideal for an old­school system played bv a group of players familiar with new­ school RPG systems. The difficulty is suitable for level 1 or 2 characters and would work well as a kickoff adventure for a campaign, since you don't have to awkwardly handwaive that "so you're all in a room" thing that usually happens at the start of a campaign.

206693.name: Open Fantasy
206693.description:
From publisher blurb:

The crawling dungeon awaits. Dark terrors lurk within its depths that need brave adventurers to go and clean out. In Open Fantasy you can take the role of a wide variety of non-class based characters to clean out as many dark and dangerous places as your heart may desire. Of course the game master may have something to say about this, depending on whether you’ve bribed her with enough soda and chips tonight.

Open Fantasy is an OpenD6 system that allows for great flexibility and character building options. Literally anything is possible within the options listed within these pages, the only limiting factor is your own imagination along with the dungeon your game master builds for you to explore.

206694.name: Dimensionist Hybrid Class
206694.description:
From publisher blurb:

Dimensionist’s think and operate outside the realm of the mundane. When working with others, she always endeavors to find a hidden method to solve a problem. If obstacles arise that are too wearisome to solve, she eliminates them with vicious and horrific magic. Combining the covert arcana of witches with the psychic concentration of keneticists, she becomes an actuary of spells and tamer of wild talents.

New Hybrid Class
Complete Spell List
Two New Archetypes
New Class Specific Feat

206695.name: Slaves in Death
206695.description:
From publisher blurb:

Monstrous Pages!

Slaves in Death sheds light on the secrets of creating and commanding animated corpses, the basest foot soldiers in the armies of the dead. Not only is there more information on how they come into being and the role they play, several variations are included to expand their presence and utility in the game. As well, an assortment of Necromancy spells supplements those in the main rulebook so players can take full advantage of the information contained herein.

206696.name: ROD: Revolt Of Defense
206696.description:
User Summary

ROD: Revolt Of Defense is game that lets you explore a random generated space and explore, attack and defend them to save the universe!

206697.name: Samsaran!
206697.description:
From publisher blurb:

The Amazing Races PDFs introduce new archetypes, feats, character traits, racial traits, and archetypes for the core, featured, and uncommon races described in the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game: Advanced Race Guide. Every PDF contains three full pages of high quality content (no fluff or filler)!

Amazing Races: Samsaran! includes new racial feats, samsaran character traits, and alternate racial traits for samsaran. In addition, this product features a new archetype for samsaran sorcerers: the Arcane Kismet!

206698.name: Feats of Heroics
206698.description:
From publisher blurb:

The More Feats! PDFs introduce a single page of themed feats for use with the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game. Every PDF contains a three pages of high-quality content (no fluff or filler)!

Feats of Heroics includes eleven new feats for utilizing and exploring the Hero Points system : Antihero's Advantage, Defy Death, Destined Leader, Forge Destiny, Guided Destiny, Heroic Action, heroic Spell, Instant Heroics, Improved Blood of Heroes, and Persistent Luck.

206699.name: 8-Bit Hordes
206699.description:
User Summary

8-Bit Hordes is a real time strategy game with pixel graphics that supports up to 10 players with multiplayer and single player.

206700.name: Encounters & Events Sci Fi Volume 2: Planetside
206700.description:
From publisher blurb:

Throughout your adventures, quests and missions, you will run into various individuals and experience odd sometimes random-seeming events and encounters. They might puzzle you, endanger your group or simply be a mystery you can never solve.

Features 100 entries, most of them with further sub-options to give you more variety and possibilities.

This volume of Encounters & Events is themed around what might be found when you dare to go explore a planet. What you find might be friendly, hostile or something you can exploit.

206701.name: The Seven Odious Orders - Seven Cavalier Orders
206701.description:
From publisher blurb:

Introducing seven new cavalier orders based on seven deadly sins. Sparked from a discussion with Adam Matherly, the orders of Anger, Envy, Gluttony, Greed, Lust, Pride, and Sloth.

206702.name: The Mistfall Refuge
206702.description:
From publisher blurb:

Deep within the Greyspire mountains, snugly nestled around the cascading waters of the Mistfall, a huddle of buildings cling to the mountainside. Here, a clan of displaced dwarves has made a living offering refuge to those who seek to temporarily disappear from the outside world. As long as the visitors pay the hefty fee and respect the rules of the secluded establishment, they are guaranteed absolute and unconditional sanctuary, no questions asked.

206703.name: Porradaria Upgrade
206703.description:
User Summary

You are a ninja searching for answers that range from fantasy to alien themes, often with a humorous background. The retro style is aimed at 90s console games.

206704.name: Desert Princes
206704.description:
From publisher blurb:

"Come, traveller and listen!

The desert is a harsh mistress and you've much to learn if you will survive. Take water with me and I'll see if you are worthy of my attention." guide, name unknown, in the Aradi desert.

The desert is always trying to kill you, whether from heat or sandstorm or lack of water or monsters never heard of before. There's beauty here and a vibrant culture that ebbs and flows like the sand, yet has a deep abiding strength. Everyone knows they're needed and has a task that is vital to the survival of their village, town or city. These are the people who created the Great Race as a test of courage and ability. The worthy are invited and the race is scheduled according to a formula no-one outside the Youlin Aradi peoples and outsiders should consider an invite a great honor.

In this guidebook, you'll find all you need to create a character or NPC from the desert region. There's some new magic, edges and other goodies to round out your character. You'll meet the Nine and see how they rule the land, sometimes cooperating and others in conflict.

206705.name: Explodo the Great
206705.description:
From publisher blurb:

Explodo the Great, Master of Blowing Things Up

Extroverted, egotistical, reckless, and interested in having a good time, Explodo the Great is a villain because he can be! He steals because it’s easy, blows things up because it looks cool, and terrorizes the population to show off. He typically warns people when the explosions are about to start, so it’s hardly his fault if they don’t run fast enough! Explodo is part fun, part crazy, and a whole lot of trouble!

206706.name: Slavistan
206706.description:
User Summary

Slavistan is a Slav simulator comedy - simulation game with pixel graphics.

206707.name: Spectrum
206707.description:
From publisher blurb:

Spectrum

The son of the Silver Age villainess known as the Color Queen, Spectrum is a self-righteous art critic turned super villain thanks to his mother’s exposure to the alien artifact she wielded for years. Now Spectrum tries to raise the public’s attitudes toward art—or at least the art he feels is worthy!

206708.name: Bres the Beautiful
206708.description:
From publisher blurb:

Bres the Beautiful

The offspring of the monstrous Fomorians and the legendary Tuatha DeDannan, Bres is a shapeshifter whose ambition has allowed him to become the Dark Lord of Annwn and the ruler of the Fomorians. Along the way he’s come into conflict with a number of supernatural heroes, including Elflight, currently one of the students at Claremont Academy and featured in Hero High!

206709.name: Drive By
206709.description:
From publisher blurb:

Drive By

Drive By, the Unstoppable Assassin specializes in hit-and-run tactics, appearing from nowhere riding his motorcycle, firing off shots at his target, and disappearing again before anyone can react. Where does he come from? How does he teleport the way he does? How will the heroes stop him?

206710.name: Porradaria 2: Pagode of the Night
206710.description:
User Summary

This is the sequel to the first Porradaria game and features either the ninja or swordsman character. Again the graphics and play resemble a console game from the 1990s.

206711.name: Esquire
206711.description:
From publisher blurb:

Esquire

Esquire is one of the world’s richest men. He was raised to be exceptional and he has embraced his high status wholeheartedly, even going so far as to hunt people for sport on their turf or, more likely, on his private island. His deadly skill with his specially-designed rifle makes him dangerous, but his money and lawyers make him almost impossible to stop.

206712.name: Atonement: Scourge of Time
206712.description:
User Summary

Atonement: Scourge of Time is a fantastic role playing game made with RPGMaker by Astronomic Games and published by New Reality Games.

206713.name: Bloo Kid 2
206713.description:
Bloo Kid 2 is a classic 2D retro-style platformer experience with lovely designed pixel-graphics and a full chiptune soundtrack.

Run, jump and swim your way through five huge worlds with nine levels each. Master brutal bossfights and discover lots of secrets in the world of Bloo Kid.

Source: The Developer Website.

206714.name: Boid
206714.description:
BOID is a Class Based RTS about a Bio Organic Infestation Drone which crashlands on a planet, enabling its primitive life forms to mutate and develop special abilities. These life forms now have to fight for dominance. It’s a game about quick decisions and mutation. A Class-Based Multiplayer RTS.

Source: The Game Website.

206715.description:
Description from the publisher:

In Ultimate Werewolf Legacy, players and the village itself have attributes that are retained between games, with events taking place in the first games having effects that ripple through remaining games. Make a bad decision early on, and it can haunt the village for years to come! Players can earn titles, which provides them with special abilities in future games, regardless of their role.

The full campaign is divided into chapters of about three games each, with each chapter designed to be played in a single night with the same group of players. Each chapter is standalone so that different players can play different chapters, but since early chapters affect successive ones, it's an even richer experience to play through more than one chapter. Even better, the chapters are designed so that you can switch moderators between games.

Ultimate Werewolf Legacy uses the basic gameplay found in Ultimate Werewolf and adds a number of twists and Legacy-style mechanisms to give the game a richer, more immersive experience than werewolf players will find any other way.
206715.name: Ultimate Werewolf Legacy
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 026 – Random Top 10 Games
Episode 10: The one about 2016 and 2017

206716.name: Moon Colonization Project
206716.description:
User Summary

You have 6 USSR members on a moon colony and you try to keep as many alive as you can.

206717.name: Masked Shooters 2
206717.description:
User Summary

You run around and shoot other players.

206718.description:
In Ethnos, players call upon the support of giants, merfolk, halfings, minotaurs, and other fantasy tribes to help them gain control of the land. After three ages of play, whoever has collected the most glory wins!

In more detail, the land of Ethnos contains twelve tribes of fantasy creatures, and in each game you choose six of them (five in a 2/3-player game), then create a deck with only the creatures in those tribes. The cards come in six colors, which match the six regions of Ethnos. Place three glory tokens in each region, arranging them from low to high.

Each player starts the game with one card in hand, then 4-12 cards are placed face up on the table. On a turn, a player either recruits an ally or plays a band of allies. In the former case, you take a face-up card (without replacing it from the deck) or the top card of the deck and add it to your hand. In the latter case, you choose a set of cards in your hand that match either in tribe or in color, play them in front of you on the table, then discard all other cards in hand. You then place one or more tokens in the region that matches the color of the top card just played, and you use the power of the tribe member on the top card just played.

At the end of the first age, whoever has the most tokens in a region scores the glory shown on the first token. After the second age, the players with the most and secondmost tokens score glory equal to the values shown on the first and second tokens. Players score again after the third age, then whoever has the most glory wins. (Games with two and three players last only two ages.)
206718.name: Ethnos
boardgamepodcastepisode: #45: Six-Player Six Pack; Las Vegas on tap; Barcelona; Mystic Vale; Betrayal at the Brewery on the Hill
#46: Ethnos six-pack review; Blood Rage on tap; CMON Expo round-up

RDTN Episode 117: Ethnos, Unfair, and The Captain is Dead

English / European Atari ST 3.5" Disk (EDOS re-release) edition

206720.description:
From the inlay:

"Die Mutant Alien Scum"

Not the most friendly of newspaper headlines you must agree, especially when it comes to promoting intergalactic relations, but then there has always been a so-called 'gutter element' to holo-journalism. (Not that anyone can remember what a gutter is, these days, but the general feeling is that it was something rather unpleasant, if fairly useful.)

And it was that heading "Die Mutant Alien Scum" that caused all the bother when it appeared in a space-wide holo-edition of the SoonDay Spirit. After several centuries of reading "little green men turned me into a potato" stories invented by SoonDay Spirit journalists, aliens throughout space were beginning to get just a little bit fed up with humanity. Naturally, human diplomats did their best to repair the damage, but your average little green man reading the SoonDay Spirit on the top of a Venusian omnibus wasn't swayed. As time went on, he got more and more fed up with being slandered and vilified in the holo-outpourings of a small and insignificant bipedal race that lived on a dirty little planet in the Sol system.

When the crazed SoonDay Spirit headline writer finally flipped his xenophobic lid and came up with DIE MUTANT ALIEN SCUM as a front-page lead story for the early edition one Tuesday, the clamour of outrage comng trom the top of the omnibuses throughout the galaxy could be heard on Earth. Alien anger continued to mount, and by the middle of Wednesday morning, political leaders on every civilized world in the galaxy realised there was only one course of action open to them if they wanted to get re-elected by their people: declare war on Earth.

So by lunchtime on Wednesday, every civilised race in the galaxy had declared war on Earth, the human race, and in particular all journalists working for the SoonDay Spirit. Expecting an easy victory in the game 'Earth V The Rest of God's Creations', alien hordes set out for the time-space adjacent to Earth and prepared to do battle with humanity's feeble space fleets. But they hadn't reckoned on the ingenuity of Earth's weapons scientists; they didn't realise that the Gemini Wing figher project was already complete. And their spies had spent so much time on earth chasing girlies and turning them into potatoes to report back on the development of awesome weapon systems such as the Windscreen Wiper of Death ....

What at first seemed to be an easy victory for alien forces turned into a bitterly-fought conflict, a space-war that is still raging in several dimensions. Which is about where you come in, as the pilot of a Gemini Wing fighter. Pausing only to shout the battle cry of the crack GW regiment you belong to - "Die Mutant Alien Scum" - you leap into the control seat of your craft, warp to a vertically-scrolling etherworld and start fighting the good fight ....

User Summary

This is a vertically scrolling shoot-em-up. The power-up system is interesting in that one-off shots of special weapons are collected and stream behind you ship in coloured orbs. Firing the alternative weapon shoots the weapons from the orbs in the order they were collected.

Most of the home versions state "Produced by The Sales Curve Ltd for Virgin Mastertronic Ltd. Coding by Imagitec Design."

206721.name: Domínio Global
206721.description:
The year is 2031 and the world entered an economic collapse with no return... But some countries understood the signs and prepared themselves for what was coming and strengthened theis military power. Now, these countries are sovereign in the midst of an expansionary conquest war.

In Domínio Global, each player controls a country with an unique power in a race to conquer territories in a Conflict Zone.

To conquer a country in conflict, the player must add its attack coefficient, the bonus from Combat Cards and / or powers with the result of a d6 roll. If the result is equal or higher that the country defense, the player conquer the land.

But attention, players will use all Action cards possible - from increasing the defense of a country in the conflict zone to destroy it with nuclear weapons - to prevent that an opponent from taking a large number of domain points.

Each player country has an unique power. The player who gathers the largest number of domain points wins the game.


O ano é 2031 e o mundo entrou em um colapso praticamente sem volta... Mas alguns países fortaleceram seu poderio militar ao avistarem a aproximação da crise e agora estão no meio de uma guerra de conquista expansionista.

Em Domínio Global, cada jogador controla um país com um poder especial em uma corrida para conquistar territórios na Zona de Conflito.

Para conquistar um país em conflito, o jogador deve somar seu coeficiente de Ataque, bônus de cartas de combates e/ou poderes com o resultado da rolagem de um d6. Se o resultado for igual ou maior, o jogador conquista o país.

Mas atenção, os jogadores usarão todas as cartas de Ação possíveis, desde aumentar a defesa de um país na Zona de Conflito a destruir países com Bombas Atômicas, para impedir que seus adversários juntem mais pontos de domínio.

206722.name: Underground Keeper
206722.description:
Underground Keeper is a logical 3D puzzle game from a first person view. You will enjoy hours of excellent entertainment in a 60 sophisticated levels and 4 fine-tuned environments.

Source: The Developer Website.

206723.name: DEADLOCK
206723.description:
Computer networks control everything in the world, therefore evil forces seek to control them. You are an experienced Systems Administrator in charge of a large and powerful network, and you hear disturbing rumors of a shadowy organization, a lunatic hacker, and his digital army.

Source: The Developer Website.

206725.name: Farm Life: Natures Adventure
206725.description:
Grow, Harvest, Nurture, Explore, Fish, Shop, Love, Mine and Events - Farm Life: Natures Adventure is full of everything from the small things like running your farm to becoming the town mayor and changing the town.

Source: The Developer Website.

206726.name: Looterkings
206726.description:
Loot as much as you can on your way up from the dark caves beneath earth to the surface, gear up and reach your ultimate goal ravaging the hallowed halls of the Elven Queen, eventually.

Source: The Game Website.

206727.name: Echoes of the Fey: The Fox's Trail
206727.description:
Echoes of the Fey: The Fox's Trail is a visual novel that blends the magic of high fantasy and the mystery of a classic detective story. Play as Sofya Rykov, a private investigator with a secret of her own—the power to turn into a cat—as she searches for the truth behind a missing Leshin soldier.

Source: The Developer Website.

206728.name: Kuraburo Kai
206728.description:
Kuraburo kai has been designed to maximize the brisk and easy feeling of blasting through blocks to your heart's content. In this unique block-breaker, you can charge up your Shuriken to launch piercing throws, or use your Ninjyutu skills to blast through obstacles.

Source: The Game Website.

206729.name: Girl Amazon Survival
206729.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still in active development and available to the public for purchase in it's unfinished state, either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between).




User Summary

Stay alive while fighting bandits and zombies.

206730.name: Gone In November
206730.description:
User Summary

Coming home after visiting your doctor for the last time, you are told that you only have three more days to live.

206731.name: Depths of the Croaking Grotto (Pathfinder)
206731.description:
From publisher blurb:

The isolated town of Kraden’s Hill, located on the edges of the frontier in the shadow of the Great Jungle, requires caravans to regularly arrive with goods and then to depart with local commodities. The caravan route is perilous, however, winding through the dangerous Fell Mountains before coming through to the frontier town beyond. Some caravans are waylaid by orcs or mountain beasts, their wreckage discovered by subsequent merchants. Others are never heard from again. But one such merchant caravan carried something of great value that the owners desperately want recovered.

TG0 Depths of the Croaking Grotto is an adventure module for a group of 4 to 6 characters levels 3 to 5. The bulk of the adventure is wilderness-based, so at least a character is recommended with strong survival skillsets. The Fell Mountains hold many dangers especially for those who go poking into its deepest depths.

A Fantasy Renaissance Adventure Module brought to you by your friends at Cut to the Chase Games!

206732.name: Depths of the Croaking Grotto (5E)
206732.description:
From publisher blurb:

The isolated town of Kraden’s Hill, located on the edges of the frontier in the shadow of the Great Jungle, requires caravans to regularly arrive with goods and then to depart with local commodities. The caravan route is perilous, however, winding through the dangerous Fell Mountains before coming through to the frontier town beyond. Some caravans are waylaid by orcs or mountain beasts, their wreckage discovered by subsequent merchants. Others are never heard from again. But one such merchant caravan carried something of great value that the owners desperately want recovered.

TG0 Depths of the Croaking Grotto is an adventure module for a group of 4 to 6 characters levels 3 to 5. A Fantasy Renaissance Adventure Module brought to you by your friends at Cut to the Chase Games!

206733.name: Broken Dreams
206733.description:
User Summary

Broken Dreams is a platform game about love with beautiful hand-drawn artwork.

206734.name: Cloud Knights
206734.description:
Cloud Knights is a physics-based fighting game where you get to wield swords, axes and other weapons in battle against the evil Undead Empire. You will wage battle among the clouds and drive the enemies off the floating island battlegrounds. You will get to save fellow knights, defeat enemy forces and crush the sources of their powers in various mission types.

Source: The Game Website.

206735.name: Corporate Lifestyle Simulator
206735.description:
Previously known as Zombies. this pixelart zombie shooter will have you smashing your way through the office with reckless abandon.

Is your Project Manager giving you case of the Monday's?

Source: The Publisher Website.

206736.name: Depths of the Croaking Grotto (C&C)
206736.description:
From publisher blurb:

The isolated town of Kraden’s Hill, located on the edges of the frontier in the shadow of the Great Jungle, requires caravans to regularly arrive with goods and then to depart with local commodities. 206737.name: Depths of the Croaking Grotto (DCC)
rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
206737.description:

The isolated town of Kraden’s Hill, located on the edges of the frontier in the shadow of the Great Jungle, requires caravans to regularly arrive with goods and then to depart with local commodities. A Fantasy Renaissance Adventure Module brought to you by your friends at Cut to the Chase Games!
